name: Major Scales — Circle of Fifths
description: Work through major scales following the circle of fifths. Open position keys first, then movable shapes for flat keys.

steps.name: C Major — Open Position
steps.instructions:
Play the C major scale in open position. Ascend from C (3rd fret, 5th string) to the highest note available, then descend. One note per beat, strict alternate picking.

C major has no sharps or flats — all natural notes.
steps.notes: Key signature: no sharps, no flats. The starting point for the circle of fifths.

steps.name: G Major — Open Position
steps.instructions:
Play the G major scale in open position. Ascend from G (3rd fret, 6th string) through to high G (3rd fret, 1st string) and back down. One note per beat.

G major has one sharp: F#.
steps.notes: Key signature: F#. Every F you play becomes F#.

steps.name: D Major — Open Position
steps.instructions:
Play the D major scale in open position. Start from open D (4th string) and ascend through the pattern, then descend. One note per beat.

D major has two sharps: F# and C#.
steps.notes: Key signature: F#, C#. Watch for C# on the 5th and 2nd strings.

steps.name: A Major — Open Position
steps.instructions:
Play the A major scale in open position. Start from open A (5th string) and ascend through the full pattern, then descend. One note per beat.

A major has three sharps: F#, C#, G#.
steps.notes: Key signature: F#, C#, G#. Notice G# appears on the 3rd and 1st strings at fret 1 and 4.

steps.name: E Major — Open Position
steps.instructions:
Play the E major scale in open position. Start from open low E (6th string) for a deep, full sound. Ascend and descend. One note per beat.

E major has four sharps: F#, C#, G#, D#.
steps.notes: Key signature: F#, C#, G#, D#. D# shows up on the 4th and 2nd strings.

steps.name: F Major — Open Position
steps.instructions:
Play the F major scale in open position. Start from F (1st fret, 6th string). Notice the Bb — this is the first flat key in the circle.

F major has one flat: Bb.
steps.notes: Key signature: Bb. The B string plays Bb at fret 1 (5th string) and stays open on the 2nd string only for B natural — wait, there is no B natural in F major! Use C (fret 1) instead.

steps.name: Bb Major — Position 1
steps.instructions:
Play Bb major using the movable pattern rooted at the 6th fret on the 6th string. This is the same shape you'd use for any major scale with the root on the 6th string. Ascend and descend. One note per beat.

Bb major has two flats: Bb, Eb.
steps.notes: Key signature: Bb, Eb. This movable shape works for any major key — just shift the root.

steps.name: Eb Major — Position 1
steps.instructions:
Play Eb major using the same movable shape, now rooted at the 11th fret on the 6th string. Same pattern as Bb major, just shifted up 5 frets. Ascend and descend.

Eb major has three flats: Bb, Eb, Ab.
steps.notes: Key signature: Bb, Eb, Ab. The movable shape is identical to Bb major — only the position changes.
